title: U.S. per capita consumption of fresh fruit by fruit type 2018
summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Per capita consumption in pounds for 11 number of Fruitss.
The Per capita consumption in pounds is highest at Fruits Bananas and lowest at Fruits Cherries.
There is a difference of 26.9 between the maximum Fruits Bananas and minimum Fruits Cherries.
min_summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Per capita consumption in pounds for 11 number of Fruitss.
The Per capita consumption in pounds is highest at Fruits Bananas and lowest at Fruits Cherries.
mid_summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Per capita consumption in pounds for 11 number of Fruitss.
The Per capita consumption in pounds is highest at Fruits Bananas and lowest at Fruits Cherries.
There is a difference of 26.9 between the maximum Fruits Bananas and minimum Fruits Cherries.
max_summary: This is a bar chart representing Fruits in the x axis and Per capita consumption in pounds in the y axis.
The Per capita consumption in pounds is appeared to be the highest at Fruits Bananas and lowest at Fruits Cherries.
Second maximum Per capita consumption in pounds is found at Fruits Apples.
The highest Fruits Bananas has 26.9 more Per capita consumption in pounds than the lowest Fruits Cherries.
The Fruits Bananas has the highest Per capita consumption in pounds, followed by Apples, and Oranges. Down to the Fruits Cherries which is the lowest.
Considered together, the average Per capita consumption in pounds in all 11 Fruitss is roughly 8.63.
The Per capita consumption in pounds is 94.9 if we add up values of all Fruitss.
